<h3 id="X21358">X(21358)&nbsp;=&nbsp; MIDPOINT OF X(3545) AND X(10519)</h3>
Barycentrics &nbsp;&nbsp; a^2+4*b^2+4*c^2 : :
<b><br>
X(21358) = 4*X(2)-X(6), 5*X(2)+X(69), X(2)+2*X(141), 13*X(2)-X(193), 5*X(2)-2*X(597), 2*X(2)+X(599), 7*X(2)-X(1992), 7*X(2)-4*X(3589), 11*X(2)-5*X(3618), X(2)-7*X(3619), 7*X(2)+5*X(3620), 17*X(2)-2*X(3629), 11*X(2)+4*X(3631), 2*X(2)-5*X(3763), 5*X(2)-X(5032), 23*X(2)-8*X(6329), 11*X(2)-2*X(8584), 11*X(2)+X(11160), 8*X(2)+X(15533), 10*X(2)-X(15534)
</b>
<p>
See César Lozada, <a href="http://www.hyacinthos.epizy.com/message.php?msg=28074"> <b>Hyacinthos 28074</b></a>.
</p>

</p>
<p>
X(21358) = midpoint of X(3545) and X(10519)<br>
X(21358) = reflection of X(i) in X(j) for these (i,j): (1691, 5215), (5102, 14848), (6034, 14971), (10304, 21167), (14561, 15699)<br>
X(21358) = X(5054)-of-anti-Artzt-triangle<br>
X(21358) = X(9166)-of-1st Brocard- triangle<br>
X(21358) = X(11287)-of-Artzt-triangle<br>
X(21358) = {X(i),X(j)}-harmonic conjugate of X(k) for these (i,j,k): (2, 69, 597), (2, 491, 13663), (2, 492, 13783), (2, 7840, 11174), (2, 11160, 3618), (69, 597, 15534), (599, 3763, 2), (3618, 3631, 6144), (3618, 11160, 8584), (3631, 8584, 11160), (7840, 16988, 2), (8252, 8253, 3054), (8584, 11160, 6144), (9761, 9763, 8667), (16644, 16645, 230), (17232, 17307, 15668)<br>
</p>
